poem:
Title: Frostbites on the Frontier

Morning bears a tale grand,
From Russia's vast primeval land,
Warns NATO with a chilled command,
At Finland's edge, a shiver expands.

Sunak chants, unwavering in stand,
Beside Scholz in Berlin's heartland,
Their duties, Europe's burning brand,
'We stand for Ukraine,' echoed in the sand.

Aid from afar does not disband,
The commitment held in every hand.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war live: Russia warns Nato drills at Finland border ‘risk possible military incidents’ 1.05pm BST UK prime minister Rishi Sunak said on Wednesday that Ukraine has the UK’s “unwavering support … for as long as it takes”. Sunak’s comments were made at a joint press conference in Berlin with Germany’s chancellor, Olaf Scholz. Scholz told journalists that the US package of support for Ukraine does not free Europe from the obligation to keep helping,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russia-Ukraine war live: Russia warns Nato drills at Finland border ‘risk possible military incidents’ 1.05pm BST UK prime minister Rishi Sunak said on Wednesday that Ukraine has the UK’s “unwavering support … for as long as it takes”. Sunak’s comments were made at a joint press conference in Berlin with Germany’s chancellor, Olaf Scholz. Scholz told journalists that the US package of support for Ukraine does not free Europe from the obligation to keep helping,
